frame.name: Interrupt_process
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cause</fen> (or associated <fen>Actor</fen>) causes an ongoing <fen>Process</fen> to temporarily stop.
<ex><fex name="Cause">The error</fex> <t>interrupted</t> <fex name="Process">the process</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>A force, process, or event that produces the interruption.
<ex><fex name="Cause">Leaving the page after you've clicked "Download"</fex> will <t>interrupt</t> the transfer.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Process
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Process</fen> goes into a paused state due to the <fen>Cause</fen> or <fen>Actor</fen>.
<ex>Leaving the page after you've clicked "Download" will <t>interrupt</t> <fex name="Process">the transfer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the interruption occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Actor
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not, but effectively causing the interruption.
<ex>In such cases <fex name="Actor">the server</fex> will automatically <t>interrupt</t> the process.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any holistic description of the event, including overall depictions (<ment>the same way</ment>) and descriptions pertaining to the <fen>Actor</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>'s influence on the character of the event.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An action or sub-event through which the <fen>Actor</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> interrupts the Process.</def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: interrupt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stop the continuous progress of.

lexUnit.name: interruption.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the ceasing of a process by an event.
